section.title: Whatever/Whoever/Whenever
section.sectiontitle: Whenever, however, etc. are conjunctions. They join two clauses together. We use whenever, however, etc. when 1) it doesn't make any difference when/what, etc. or we don't have to be specific. 2) we don't know the exact details of when/what, etc.
section.text1a: Come whenever you can. (It doesn't matter exactly when you come)
section.text2a: She'll speak to whoever is available.  (We don't know exactly who is available)
section.sectiontitle2: What/who/when is a little different to whatever/whoever/whenever. Compare:
section.text4: <FONT COLOR='#F50000'>NOT</FONT> What you just said, repeat it!
section.text4a: Whatever you just said, repeat it!

section.title: Whatever/Whoever/Whenever
section.sectiontitle: However has two meanings. Compare: The second however is used to contrast two statements.
section.text1a: However you go, whether by train or car, it will take two hours.
section.text2a: It takes two hours by car. However, if you go by train, it takes only one hour.
